name: DNWD Feedback
author: Derek Nolan Web Develoment

sections.description:
DNWD Feedback allows users to give feedback on a site by clicking on the sites elements, and leaving comments.

Only logged in users can leave and see comments. Because of this, standard users will not be able to see comments so DNWD Feedback can be used on live sites in some cases.

Example use case:

The old way of doing it: A developer makes a development site live and sends it to the client(s) for feedback. His computer and phone then explode with messages, calls, emails and carrier pigeons.

The new way of doing it: Before making a site live, a developer installs DNWD Feedback, creates users account(s) for the client(s), and forwards the development link with a brief discription of how to use DNWD Feedback.
The client then adds all there feedback directly on to the site, making snagging simpler for the developer.

An off switch is also included in the top right hand corner to allow for standard interactions with page elements (clicking links).
sections.installation: Download DNWD Feedback. Activate it. Then head over to the front end and start adding some comments.
sections.faq:
Installation Instructions

Download DNWD Feedback. Activate it. Then head over to the front end and start adding some comments.
